page.title: 11CHURCHES IN CATERHAM PAGE 2
page.content: {CHURCH OF THE SACRED HEART} The Roman Catholic parish of Caterham was re-formed in 1879 when Fr.Roe was appointed resident priest. The stone- built church was opened in 1881. A spire was planned but money ran so it has a spiral staircase going nowhere! When the church was being built workmen took a{BARREL OF BEER}from outside the Blacksmiths Arms. When the police were called the barrel was hidden in the church foundations and concreted over. In 1930 a north aisle and new porch were added. In the 106 years of the parish's life there have only been 5 parish priests. In the first 100 years there were only 3, Canon Francis Roe, Canon Walter Cooksey and Fr. Cyril Scarborough. To celebrate the{CENTENARY}of the parish a new Parish Centre was built in 1979.
